page.title: 10EDUCATION
page.content: Winters in our area are generally severe with snow lying for up to four months. Severe frost is often prolonged. These winter conditions can result in the local school being closed for periods up to a week owing to blocked roads. All pupils travel by bus provided by the Education Authority and many pupils live on isolated farms. School lunches made at Tarland in the central kitchen sometimes cannot get through. Emergency food rations are kept in school and pupils' emergency storm addresses maybe used. Craigievar School keeps a log book dating back to 1939. It is occasionally referred to by visitors who once attended the school. One afternoon a week, mothers help tp make up paints, cut paper, do library duty and help us to bake.
